item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "If we were all on trial for our thoughts, we would all be hanged." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "There is no God and we are his prophets." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "He knew only that his child was his warrant. He said: If he is not the word of God God never spoke." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Where men can't live gods fare no better." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "Love is the answer, said the songs, and that's OK. It was OK, I supposed, as an answer. But no more than that. It was not a solution; it wasn't really even an answer, just a reply." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "It wasn't only wickedness and scheming that made people unhappy, it was confusion and misunderstanding; above all, it was the failure to grasp the simple truth that other people are as real as you." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "At the heart of all beauty lies something inhuman." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I do not believe in God and I am not an atheist." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "For one human being to love another human being: that is perhaps the most difficult task that has been given to us, the ultimate, the final problem and proof, the work for which all other work is merely preparation." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I want to be with those who know secret things or else alone." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Ah, how good it is to be among people who are reading!" -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Logan Pearsall Smith
item.description: "People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading." -- Logan Pearsall Smith

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Love is never any better than the lover. " -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never allow someone to be your priority while allowing yourself to be their option." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by David Levithan
item.description:
"<b>candid</b>, <i>adj</i>.
"Most times, when I'm having sex, I'd rather be reading." This was, I admit, a strange thing to say on a second date. I guess was just giving you warning. "Most times when I'm reading," you said, "I'd rather be having sex"." -- David Levithan

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "The mistake is thinking that there can be an antidote to the uncertainty." -- David Levithan

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one." -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "As a writer, I'm more interested in what people tell themselves happened rather than what actually happened" -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Kazuo Ishiguro
item.description: "I keep thinking about this river somewhere, with the water moving really fast. And these two people in the water, trying to hold onto each other, holding on as hard as they can, but in the end it's just too much. The current's too strong. They've got to let go, drift apart. That's how it is with us. It's a shame, Kath, because we've loved each other all our lives. But in the end, we can't stay together forever." -- Kazuo Ishiguro

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "If ever there is tomorrow when we're not together... there is something you must always remember. You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think. But the most important thing is, even if we're apart... I'll always be with you." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "Seek freedom and become captive of your desires. Seek discipline and find your liberty." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Jean Paul Sarte
item.description: "Like all dreamers I confuse disenchantment with truth." -- Jean Paul Sarte

item.title: Gabriela add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift." -- Mary Oliver
